title: 109_hr4224
content: The Act may be cited as the "Proportionate Final Benefit Act of 2005" and it allows for the continuation of benefits through the month of the beneficiary's death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Old-Age Insurance Benefits and Wife's Insurance Benefits, including redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Husband's Insurance Benefits and Child's Insurance Benefits by redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits by changing the criteria for when benefits end, such as in the event of remarriage or death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits by changing the criteria for when benefits end, such as in the event of remarriage or death. The amendments include adjustments to Mother's and Father's Insurance Benefits and Parent's Insurance Benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust benefits for various categories, including Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits, Mother's and Father's Insurance Benefits, and Parent's Insurance Benefits. Changes include adjusting criteria for when benefits end due to remarriage or death. SEC. 3. COMPUTATION AND PAYMENT OF LAST MONTHLY PAYMENT. Amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to address the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit due to death. The amount of an individual's monthly insurance benefit under this section paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in the month before their death. This applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Section 223 of the Act is amended to include a new subsection related to Disability Insurance Benefits. The last payment of benefit terminated due to death. The last payment of benefit terminated due to death shall be calculated based on a fraction of the monthly benefit amount, with the numerator being the number of days in the month before the individual's death, and the denominator being the total number of days in the month. This calculation applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Section 228 of the Act is amended to provide benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals. "Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death" The last payment of a deceased individual's monthly benefit is calculated based on the number of days in the month before their death. The benefit amount is adjusted accordingly and paid out as specified in section 204(d) of the title. The Social Security Act is amended to disregard the benefit for the month of death under family maximum provisions. These amendments apply to deaths occurring after the enactment of the Act.
